item.title: First Welcome Interface
item.dc:creator: @Tonic Tonic
item.description:
@Tonic wrote:

[quote=“lt ruls, post:1, topic:308750”][center]This is my first interface

First download link [add in your sprites folder]:
http://uppit.com/v/A2P5D1JB
[/center]
Add these methods in Class9.java:

[code]public static void addSprite(int i, int j, int k, String spriteName)
{
Class9 dSprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
dSprite.anInt250 = i;
dSprite.anInt236 = i;
dSprite.anInt262 = 5;
dSprite.anInt217 = 1;
dSprite.anInt214 = 0;
dSprite.anInt220 = 20;
dSprite.anInt267 = 20;
dSprite.aByte254 = 0;
dSprite.anInt230 = 52;
dSprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = loadAscheriitSprite(j, spriteName);
dSprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadAscheriitSprite(k, spriteName);
}

public static void addCloseButton(int i, String spriteName, int width, int height, String s)
{
Class9 class9 = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
class9.anInt250 = i;
class9.anInt236 = i;
class9.anInt262 = 5;
class9.anInt217 = 1;
class9.anInt214 = 0;
class9.anInt220 = width;
class9.anInt267 = height;
class9.aByte254 = 0;
class9.anInt230 = 52;
class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = CustomSpriteLoader(0, spriteName);
class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = CustomSpriteLoader(0, spriteName);
class9.aString221 = s;
}

public static void addActionButton(int i, int width, int height, String s, String spriteName)
{
Class9 class9 = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
class9.anInt250 = i;
class9.anInt236 = i;
class9.anInt262 = 5;
class9.anInt217 = 1;
class9.anInt214 = 0;
class9.anInt220 = width;
class9.anInt267 = height;
class9.aByte254 = 0;
class9.anInt230 = 52;
class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = CustomSpriteLoader(0, spriteName);
class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = CustomSpriteLoader(0, spriteName);
class9.aString221 = s;
}
[/code]
If after compile you get erros add this:

public static void Welcome interface(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4[] wid) { Class9 intWelcome interface = addDTab(0); intWelcome interface.anIntArray240 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray240[0] = 1; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241[0] = 4; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272[0] = 16; //Main sprite addSprite(1, 0, 0, "mainframe"); //Control 2 (0) intWelcome interface.anIntArray240[1] = 2; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241[1] = 469; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272[1] = 28; //Image addSprite(2, 0, 0, "close"); //Added 1 controls. }
We are still in Class9.java
No search for:

aClass44 ==

And after this add this:

Welcome interface(aclass30_sub2_sub1_sub4);

[center]All credits to Martix
I’m From Lithuania!
[/center][/quote]

Looks all the same as others. Fine for a 1st.

Read full topic

item.title: First Welcome Interface
item.dc:creator: @lt_ruls lt ruls
item.description:
@lt_ruls wrote:

[center]This is my first interface

First download link [add in your sprites folder]:
http://uppit.com/v/A2P5D1JB
[/center]
Add these methods in Class9.java:

[code]public static void addSprite(int i, int j, int k, String spriteName)
{
Class9 dSprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
dSprite.anInt250 = i;
dSprite.anInt236 = i;
dSprite.anInt262 = 5;
dSprite.anInt217 = 1;
dSprite.anInt214 = 0;
dSprite.anInt220 = 20;
dSprite.anInt267 = 20;
dSprite.aByte254 = 0;
dSprite.anInt230 = 52;
dSprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = loadAscheriitSprite(j, spriteName);
dSprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadAscheriitSprite(k, spriteName);
}

public static void addCloseButton(int i, String spriteName, int width, int height, String s)
{
Class9 class9 = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
class9.anInt250 = i;
class9.anInt236 = i;
class9.anInt262 = 5;
class9.anInt217 = 1;
class9.anInt214 = 0;
class9.anInt220 = width;
class9.anInt267 = height;

class9.anInt230 = 52;

class9.aString221 = s;
}

public static void addActionButton(int i, int width, int height, String s, String spriteName)
{
Class9 class9 = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
class9.anInt250 = i;
class9.anInt236 = i;
class9.anInt262 = 5;
class9.anInt217 = 1;
class9.anInt214 = 0;
class9.anInt220 = width;
class9.anInt267 = height;

class9.anInt230 = 52;

class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = CustomSpriteLoader(0, spriteName);
class9.aString221 = s;
}
[/code]
If after compile you get erros add this:

public static void Welcome interface(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4[] wid) { Class9 intWelcome interface = addDTab(0); intWelcome interface.anIntArray240 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272 = new int[2]; intWelcome interface.anIntArray240[0] = 1; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241[0] = 4; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272[0] = 16; //Main sprite addSprite(1, 0, 0, "mainframe"); //Control 2 (0) intWelcome interface.anIntArray240[1] = 2; intWelcome interface.anIntArray241[1] = 469; intWelcome interface.anIntArray272[1] = 28; //Image addSprite(2, 0, 0, "close"); //Added 1 controls. }
We are still in Class9.java
No search for:

aClass44 ==

And after this add this:

Welcome interface(aclass30_sub2_sub1_sub4);
